message.content:
We need to determine how much money was “paid in” by the owners at the very beginning. In these records the only “initial” transactions are the ones with the id "Initial20231231001". In this problem there are three such rows:

• Cash deposit – amount: 5,000,000  
• Bank deposit – amount: 15,000,000  
• Fixed Assets – amount: 8,000,000  

Their sum is the initial capital injected (the “paid‐in capital”):

  5,000,000 + 15,000,000 + 8,000,000 = 28,000,000

There are no subsequent transactions that indicate any further contributions to the paid‐in capital. (Other transactions such as purchases, expenses, sales, depreciation, interest etc. affect other balance sheet or income statement accounts but not the capital provided by owners.) 

Thus, the initial paid‐in capital – and therefore the ending paid‐in capital – remain at 28,000,000.00

Below is the answer in the required JSON format:

--------------------------------------------------
{"solution": {'Paid-in Capital Initial Value': '28000000.00', 'Paid-in Capital End Value': '28000000.00'} }
